text: Lithium diisopropylamide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is [(CH3)2CH]2NLi. It is used as a strong base. It is a colorless solid. It was first made by Hamell and Levine in 1950. Lithium diisopropylamide is used as the primary example of a superbase by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. == References == Category:Lithium compounds Category:Superbases Category:Organonitrogen compounds
title: Lithium diisopropylamide
